item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Tree has been undermined by fire and foxes digging underneath, 15th July
item.description:
Tree foundation undermined by vandalism and foxes digging significantly . Tree is dead and in danger of collapse This is a thoroughfare for public and children going to school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London

See photos

item.title: Over-hanging tree branches obscuring street light, 15th July
item.description:
Over-hanging tree branches obscuring street light, Light No. 13T4 near corner of Kingsway and Towncourt Crescent. Note : This problem has been reported before several times before in previous years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Towncourt Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 15th July
item.description:
Bins are only being collected every 2 weeks and they’re always overflowing. It’s leading to constant fly-tipping and the area is filthy. Please address this — it’s disgusting. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarissa Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass on the road and pavement, 15th July
item.description:
Glass dropped on the road/pavement by bin men when collecting the overflowing commercial bins

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hamilton Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poorly lit, broken lights, unsafe at night, 15th July
item.description:
The lighting in London Bridge walk between the bit that City of London manage and the railway station is very poorly lit. Too many broken lights. Very dull lighting for those that remain. Very dark and scary at night and early morning. I've reported this a number of times. It must be quite scary for women at night. Please fix it before it gets darker earlier at night and later in the morning. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Bridge Walk, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish. More each day, 15th July
item.description:
This pile of flytipped rubbish is getting bigger each day. There is also a large amount of broken glass on the corner of Bebbington and Mineral st. This is a recurrent problem but this particular pile has been there for about a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mineral Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree, corner of greenway and green lane, 15th July
item.description:
Tree fallen in road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Green Lane, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Littering, 15th July
item.description:
There is a huge amount of litter from homeless people in these plants, bushes, they need to be regularly cleaned please.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree base dug up by an animal, 15th July
item.description:
Base of tree seems dug up by an animal. The soil is now on the pavement, obstructing the way for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Road, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping of furniture and waste, 15th July
item.description:
Fly tipping for the last 4/5 years of fridges, mirrors with bits of broken glass hanging out, food waste, broken tv’s, broken furniture, multiple garden waste bags, children’s dirty boxers, tins of paint, cigarette butts etc

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of takeaway litter on Bugsby’s Way between Peninsula Park Road and Horn Lane, 15th July
item.description:
There is a disgraceful amount of litter on this stretch of pavement on the south side of Bugsby’s Way. Most of it is from McDonald’s takeaways. The grassed areas are also very overgrown and strewn with litter. Very unpleasant for pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bugsby's Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leighton Road both lanes, 15th July
item.description:
LOTS OF SCREE MAKING BRAKING HARDER Due to recent road surfacing, lots of the surfacing comes off when vehicles drive over it. This has left much scree on the sides of the road on both lanes. It's harder to break, particularly for cyclists. Not safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Leighton Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive hole dug in street, 15th July
item.description:
Someone has dug a huge hole in the street…. The crew have left ladders and various amounts of wood on the street. Have been here a few days now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25-27, Old Queen Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown brambles, 15th July
item.description:
FixMyStreet ref: 7876049. has been closed saying the pavement is private property. I doubt the pavement in front of 106 Hillingdon is private. To avoid the brambles you have to step on to the verge. Why would the pavement suddenly be private property that we all walk on? Genuinely baffled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
